DOC.brief_summary: To test whether biofeedback ( BF ) add pelvic floor muscle training ( PFMT ) promote additional benefit PFMT alone stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Outpatient Biofeedback Addition Home Pelvic Floor Muscle Exercises
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : The aim study test hypothesis outpatient BF add home PFMT result increase frequency home exercise set per month perform patient objective cure rate 3 month supervise training . Secondarily , investigate subjective objective clinical parameter group receive BF together PFMT 3 month supervise training , long term 9-month follow-up . Method : 72 incontinent woman randomize : BF Group ( outpatient BF + home PFMT ) PFMT Group ( outpatient PFMT + home PFMT ) . Assessments : baseline 3 month supervise treatment 9-month follow-up ( 6 additional month home PFMT without supervision ) . Primary outcome : adherence - monthly exercise set perform ( exercise diary ) objective cure SUI ( pad test ) 3 month . Secondary outcome : urinary symptom , muscle function , quality life , adhesion subject cure two time-points .
DOC.criteria: SUI mixed urinary incontinence predominant symptom SUI â‰¥ 2 g leakage measure pad test young 18 year old chronic degenerative disease pelvic organ prolapse great stage I POPQ neurologic psychiatric disease previously undergone pelvic floor reeducation program and/or previous pelvic floor surgery
